14#ifndef DNS_VIEW_H
15#define DNS_VIEW_H 1
16
17/*****
18 ***** Module Info
19 *****/
20
21/*! \file dns/view.h
22 * \brief
23 * DNS View
24 *
25 * A "view" is a DNS namespace, together with an optional resolver and a
26 * forwarding policy. A "DNS namespace" is a (possibly empty) set of
27 * authoritative zones together with an optional cache and optional
28 * "hints" information.
29 *
30 * Views start out "unfrozen". In this state, core attributes like
31 * the cache, set of zones, and forwarding policy may be set. While
32 * "unfrozen", the caller (e.g. nameserver configuration loading
33 * code), must ensure exclusive access to the view. When the view is
34 * "frozen", the core attributes become immutable, and the view module
35 * will ensure synchronization. Freezing allows the view's core attributes
36 * to be accessed without locking.
37 *
38 * MP:
39 *\li Before the view is frozen, the caller must ensure synchronization.
40 *
41 *\li After the view is frozen, the module guarantees appropriate
42 * synchronization of any data structures it creates and manipulates.
43 *
44 * Reliability:
45 *\li No anticipated impact.
46 *
47 * Resources:
48 *\li TBS
49 *
50 * Security:
51 *\li No anticipated impact.
52 *
53 * Standards:
54 *\li None.
55 */
56
57#include <stdbool.h>
58#include <stdio.h>
59#include <inttypes.h>
60
61#include <isc/lang.h>
62#include <isc/magic.h>
63#include <isc/event.h>
64#include <isc/mutex.h>
65#include <isc/net.h>
66#include <isc/refcount.h>
67#include <isc/rwlock.h>
68#include <isc/stdtime.h>
69
70#include <dns/acl.h>
71#include <dns/catz.h>
72#include <dns/clientinfo.h>
73#include <dns/dnstap.h>
74#include <dns/fixedname.h>
75#include <dns/rrl.h>
76#include <dns/rdatastruct.h>
77#include <dns/rpz.h>
78#include <dns/types.h>
79#include <dns/zt.h>
80
81ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
82
83struct dns_view {
84 /* Unlocked. */
85 unsigned int magic;
86 isc_mem_t * mctx;
87 dns_rdataclass_t rdclass;
88 char * name;
89 dns_zt_t * zonetable;
90 dns_resolver_t * resolver;
91 dns_adb_t * adb;
92 dns_requestmgr_t * requestmgr;
93 dns_cache_t * cache;
94 dns_db_t * cachedb;
95 dns_db_t * hints;
96
97 /*
98 * security roots and negative trust anchors.
99 * internal use only; access via * dns_view_getsecroots()
100 */
101 dns_keytable_t * secroots_priv;
102 dns_ntatable_t * ntatable_priv;
103
104 isc_mutex_t lock;
105 bool frozen;
106 isc_task_t * task;
107 isc_event_t resevent;
108 isc_event_t adbevent;
109 isc_event_t reqevent;
110 isc_stats_t * adbstats;
111 isc_stats_t * resstats;
112 dns_stats_t * resquerystats;
113 bool cacheshared;
114
115 /* Configurable data. */
116 dns_tsig_keyring_t * statickeys;
117 dns_tsig_keyring_t * dynamickeys;
118 dns_peerlist_t * peers;
119 dns_order_t * order;
120 dns_fwdtable_t * fwdtable;
121 bool recursion;
122 bool qminimization;
123 bool qmin_strict;
124 bool auth_nxdomain;
125 bool use_glue_cache;
126 bool minimal_any;
127 dns_minimaltype_t minimalresponses;
128 bool enablednssec;
129 bool enablevalidation;
130 bool acceptexpired;
131 bool requireservercookie;
132 bool synthfromdnssec;
133 bool trust_anchor_telemetry;
134 bool root_key_sentinel;
135 dns_transfer_format_t transfer_format;
136 dns_acl_t * cacheacl;
137 dns_acl_t * cacheonacl;
138 dns_acl_t * queryacl;
139 dns_acl_t * queryonacl;
140 dns_acl_t * recursionacl;
141 dns_acl_t * recursiononacl;
142 dns_acl_t * sortlist;
143 dns_acl_t * notifyacl;
144 dns_acl_t * transferacl;
145 dns_acl_t * updateacl;
146 dns_acl_t * upfwdacl;
147 dns_acl_t * denyansweracl;
148 dns_acl_t * nocasecompress;
149 bool msgcompression;
150 dns_rbt_t * answeracl_exclude;
151 dns_rbt_t * denyanswernames;
152 dns_rbt_t * answernames_exclude;
153 dns_rrl_t * rrl;
154 bool provideixfr;
155 bool requestnsid;
156 bool sendcookie;
157 dns_ttl_t maxcachettl;
158 dns_ttl_t maxncachettl;
159 dns_ttl_t mincachettl;
160 dns_ttl_t minncachettl;
161 uint32_t nta_lifetime;
162 uint32_t nta_recheck;
163 char *nta_file;
164 dns_ttl_t prefetch_trigger;
165 dns_ttl_t prefetch_eligible;
166 in_port_t dstport;
167 dns_aclenv_t aclenv;
168 dns_rdatatype_t preferred_glue;
169 bool flush;
170 dns_namelist_t * delonly;
171 bool rootdelonly;
172 dns_namelist_t * rootexclude;
173 bool checknames;
174 dns_name_t * dlv;
175 dns_fixedname_t dlv_fixed;
176 uint16_t maxudp;
177 dns_ttl_t staleanswerttl;
178 dns_stale_answer_t staleanswersok; /* rndc setting */
179 bool staleanswersenable; /* named.conf setting */
180 uint16_t nocookieudp;
181 uint16_t padding;
182 dns_acl_t * pad_acl;
183 unsigned int maxbits;
184 dns_dns64list_t dns64;
185 unsigned int dns64cnt;
186 dns_rpz_zones_t *rpzs;
187 dns_catz_zones_t *catzs;
188 dns_dlzdblist_t dlz_searched;
189 dns_dlzdblist_t dlz_unsearched;
190 uint32_t fail_ttl;
191 dns_badcache_t *failcache;
192
193 /*
194 * Configurable data for server use only,
195 * locked by server configuration lock.
196 */
197 dns_acl_t * matchclients;
198 dns_acl_t * matchdestinations;
199 bool matchrecursiveonly;
200
201 /* Locked by themselves. */
202 isc_refcount_t references;
203
204 /* Locked by lock. */
205 unsigned int weakrefs;
206 unsigned int attributes;
207 /* Under owner's locking control. */
208 ISC_LINK(struct dns_view) link;
209 dns_viewlist_t * viewlist;
210
211 dns_zone_t * managed_keys;
212 dns_zone_t * redirect;
213 dns_name_t * redirectzone; /* points to
214 * redirectfixed
215 * when valid */
216 dns_fixedname_t redirectfixed;
217
218 /*
219 * File and configuration data for zones added at runtime
220 * (only used in BIND9).
221 *
222 * XXX: This should be a pointer to an opaque type that
223 * named implements.
224 */
225 char * new_zone_dir;
226 char * new_zone_file;
227 char * new_zone_db;
228 void * new_zone_dbenv;
229 uint64_t new_zone_mapsize;
230 void * new_zone_config;
231 void (*cfg_destroy)(void **);
232 isc_mutex_t new_zone_lock;
233
234 unsigned char secret[32]; /* Client secret */
235 unsigned int v6bias;
236
237 dns_dtenv_t *dtenv; /* Dnstap environment */
238 dns_dtmsgtype_t dttypes; /* Dnstap message types
239 to log */
240
241 /* Registered module instances */
242 void *plugins;
243 void (*plugins_free)(isc_mem_t *, void **);
244
245 /* Hook table */
246 void *hooktable; /* ns_hooktable */
247 void (*hooktable_free)(isc_mem_t *, void **);
248
249};
250
251#define DNS_VIEW_MAGIC ISC_MAGIC('V','i','e','w')
252#define DNS_VIEW_VALID(view) ISC_MAGIC_VALID(view, DNS_VIEW_MAGIC)
253
254#define DNS_VIEWATTR_RESSHUTDOWN 0x01
255#define DNS_VIEWATTR_ADBSHUTDOWN 0x02
256#define DNS_VIEWATTR_REQSHUTDOWN 0x04
257
258#ifdef HAVE_LMDB
259#include <lmdb.h>
260/*
261 * MDB_NOTLS is used to prevent problems after configuration is reloaded, due
262 * to the way LMDB's use of thread-local storage (TLS) interacts with the BIND9
263 * thread model.
264 */
265#define DNS_LMDB_COMMON_FLAGS (MDB_CREATE | MDB_NOSUBDIR | MDB_NOTLS)
266#ifndef __OpenBSD__
267#define DNS_LMDB_FLAGS (DNS_LMDB_COMMON_FLAGS)
268#else /* __OpenBSD__ */
269/*
270 * OpenBSD does not have a unified buffer cache, which requires both reads and
271 * writes to be performed using mmap().
272 */
273#define DNS_LMDB_FLAGS (DNS_LMDB_COMMON_FLAGS | MDB_WRITEMAP)
274#endif /* __OpenBSD__ */
275#endif /* HAVE_LMDB */
276
277isc_result_t
278dns_view_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, dns_rdataclass_t rdclass,
279 const char *name, dns_view_t **viewp);
280/*%<
281 * Create a view.
282 *
283 * Notes:
284 *
285 *\li The newly created view has no cache, no resolver, and an empty
286 * zone table. The view is not frozen.
287 *
288 * Requires:
289 *
290 *\li 'mctx' is a valid memory context.
291 *
292 *\li 'rdclass' is a valid class.
293 *
294 *\li 'name' is a valid C string.
295 *
296 *\li viewp != NULL && *viewp == NULL
297 *
298 * Returns:
299 *
300 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
301 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
302 *
303 *\li Other errors are possible.
304 */
305
306void
307dns_view_attach(dns_view_t *source, dns_view_t **targetp);
308/*%<
309 * Attach '*targetp' to 'source'.
310 *
311 * Requires:
312 *
313 *\li 'source' is a valid, frozen view.
314 *
315 *\li 'targetp' points to a NULL dns_view_t *.
316 *
317 * Ensures:
318 *
319 *\li *targetp is attached to source.
320 *
321 *\li While *targetp is attached, the view will not shut down.
322 */
323
324void
325dns_view_detach(dns_view_t **viewp);
326/*%<
327 * Detach '*viewp' from its view.
328 *
329 * Requires:
330 *
331 *\li 'viewp' points to a valid dns_view_t *
332 *
333 * Ensures:
334 *
335 *\li *viewp is NULL.
336 */
337
338void
339dns_view_flushanddetach(dns_view_t **viewp);
340/*%<
341 * Detach '*viewp' from its view. If this was the last reference
342 * uncommitted changed in zones will be flushed to disk.
343 *
344 * Requires:
345 *
346 *\li 'viewp' points to a valid dns_view_t *
347 *
348 * Ensures:
349 *
350 *\li *viewp is NULL.
351 */
352
353void
354dns_view_weakattach(dns_view_t *source, dns_view_t **targetp);
355/*%<
356 * Weakly attach '*targetp' to 'source'.
357 *
358 * Requires:
359 *
360 *\li 'source' is a valid, frozen view.
361 *
362 *\li 'targetp' points to a NULL dns_view_t *.
363 *
364 * Ensures:
365 *
366 *\li *targetp is attached to source.
367 *
368 * \li While *targetp is attached, the view will not be freed.
369 */
370
371void
372dns_view_weakdetach(dns_view_t **targetp);
373/*%<
374 * Detach '*viewp' from its view.
375 *
376 * Requires:
377 *
378 *\li 'viewp' points to a valid dns_view_t *.
379 *
380 * Ensures:
381 *
382 *\li *viewp is NULL.
383 */
384
385isc_result_t
386dns_view_createzonetable(dns_view_t *view);
387/*%<
388 * Create a zonetable for the view.
389 *
390 * Requires:
391 *
392 *\li 'view' is a valid, unfrozen view.
393 *
394 *\li 'view' does not have a zonetable already.
395 *
396 * Returns:
397 *
398 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
399 *
400 *\li Any error that dns_zt_create() can return.
401 */
402
403isc_result_t
404dns_view_createresolver(dns_view_t *view,
405 isc_taskmgr_t *taskmgr,
406 unsigned int ntasks, unsigned int ndisp,
407 isc_socketmgr_t *socketmgr,
408 isc_timermgr_t *timermgr,
409 unsigned int options,
410 dns_dispatchmgr_t *dispatchmgr,
411 dns_dispatch_t *dispatchv4,
412 dns_dispatch_t *dispatchv6);
413/*%<
414 * Create a resolver and address database for the view.
415 *
416 * Requires:
417 *
418 *\li 'view' is a valid, unfrozen view.
419 *
420 *\li 'view' does not have a resolver already.
421 *
422 *\li The requirements of dns_resolver_create() apply to 'taskmgr',
423 * 'ntasks', 'socketmgr', 'timermgr', 'options', 'dispatchv4', and
424 * 'dispatchv6'.
425 *
426 * Returns:
427 *
428 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
429 *
430 *\li Any error that dns_resolver_create() can return.
431 */
432
433void
434dns_view_setcache(dns_view_t *view, dns_cache_t *cache, bool shared);
435/*%<
436 * Set the view's cache database. If 'shared' is true, this means the cache
437 * is created by another view and is shared with that view. dns_view_setcache()
438 * is a backward compatible version equivalent to setcache2(..., false).
439 *
440 * Requires:
441 *
442 *\li 'view' is a valid, unfrozen view.
443 *
444 *\li 'cache' is a valid cache.
445 *
446 * Ensures:
447 *
448 * \li The cache of 'view' is 'cached.
449 *
450 *\li If this is not the first call to dns_view_setcache() for this
451 * view, then previously set cache is detached.
452 */
453
454void
455dns_view_sethints(dns_view_t *view, dns_db_t *hints);
456/*%<
457 * Set the view's hints database.
458 *
459 * Requires:
460 *
461 *\li 'view' is a valid, unfrozen view, whose hints database has not been
462 * set.
463 *
464 *\li 'hints' is a valid zone database.
465 *
466 * Ensures:
467 *
468 * \li The hints database of 'view' is 'hints'.
469 */
470
471void
472dns_view_setkeyring(dns_view_t *view, dns_tsig_keyring_t *ring);
473void
474dns_view_setdynamickeyring(dns_view_t *view, dns_tsig_keyring_t *ring);
475/*%<
476 * Set the view's static TSIG keys
477 *
478 * Requires:
479 *
480 * \li 'view' is a valid, unfrozen view, whose static TSIG keyring has not
481 * been set.
482 *
483 *\li 'ring' is a valid TSIG keyring
484 *
485 * Ensures:
486 *
487 *\li The static TSIG keyring of 'view' is 'ring'.
488 */
489
490void
491dns_view_getdynamickeyring(dns_view_t *view, dns_tsig_keyring_t **ringp);
492/*%<
493 * Return the views dynamic keys.
494 *
495 * \li 'view' is a valid, unfrozen view.
496 * \li 'ringp' != NULL && ringp == NULL.
497 */
498
499void
500dns_view_setdstport(dns_view_t *view, in_port_t dstport);
501/*%<
502 * Set the view's destination port. This is the port to
503 * which outgoing queries are sent. The default is 53,
504 * the standard DNS port.
505 *
506 * Requires:
507 *
508 *\li 'view' is a valid view.
509 *
510 *\li 'dstport' is a valid TCP/UDP port number.
511 *
512 * Ensures:
513 *\li External name servers will be assumed to be listening
514 * on 'dstport'. For servers whose address has already
515 * obtained obtained at the time of the call, the view may
516 * continue to use the previously set port until the address
517 * times out from the view's address database.
518 */
519
520
521isc_result_t
522dns_view_addzone(dns_view_t *view, dns_zone_t *zone);
523/*%<
524 * Add zone 'zone' to 'view'.
525 *
526 * Requires:
527 *
528 *\li 'view' is a valid, unfrozen view.
529 *
530 *\li 'zone' is a valid zone.
531 */
532
533void
534dns_view_freeze(dns_view_t *view);
535/*%<
536 * Freeze view. No changes can be made to view configuration while frozen.
537 *
538 * Requires:
539 *
540 *\li 'view' is a valid, unfrozen view.
541 *
542 * Ensures:
543 *
544 *\li 'view' is frozen.
545 */
546
547void
548dns_view_thaw(dns_view_t *view);
549/*%<
550 * Thaw view. This allows zones to be added or removed at runtime. This is
551 * NOT thread-safe; the caller MUST have run isc_task_exclusive() prior to
552 * thawing the view.
553 *
554 * Requires:
555 *
556 *\li 'view' is a valid, frozen view.
557 *
558 * Ensures:
559 *
560 *\li 'view' is no longer frozen.
561 */
562
563isc_result_t
564dns_view_find(dns_view_t *view, const dns_name_t *name, dns_rdatatype_t type,
565 isc_stdtime_t now, unsigned int options,
566 bool use_hints, bool use_static_stub,
567 dns_db_t **dbp, dns_dbnode_t **nodep, dns_name_t *foundname,
568 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset, dns_rdataset_t *sigrdataset);
569/*%<
570 * Find an rdataset whose owner name is 'name', and whose type is
571 * 'type'.
572 * In general, this function first searches view's zone and cache DBs for the
573 * best match data against 'name'. If nothing found there, and if 'use_hints'
574 * is true, the view's hint DB (if configured) is searched.
575 * If the view is configured with a static-stub zone which gives the longest
576 * match for 'name' among the zones, however, the cache DB is not consulted
577 * unless 'use_static_stub' is false (see below about this argument).
578 *
579 * dns_view_find() is a backward compatible version equivalent to
580 * dns_view_find2() with use_static_stub argument being false.
581 *
582 * Notes:
583 *
584 *\li See the description of dns_db_find() for information about 'options'.
585 * If the caller sets #DNS_DBFIND_GLUEOK, it must ensure that 'name'
586 * and 'type' are appropriate for glue retrieval.
587 *
588 *\li If 'now' is zero, then the current time will be used.
589 *
590 *\li If 'use_hints' is true, and the view has a hints database, then
591 * it will be searched last. If the answer is found in the hints
592 * database, the result code will be DNS_R_HINT. If the name is found
593 * in the hints database but not the type, the result code will be
594 * #DNS_R_HINTNXRRSET.
595 *
596 *\li If 'use_static_stub' is false and the longest match zone for 'name'
597 * is a static-stub zone, it's ignored and the cache and/or hints will be
598 * searched. In the majority of the cases this argument should be
599 * false. The only known usage of this argument being true is
600 * if this search is for a "bailiwick" glue A or AAAA RRset that may
601 * best match a static-stub zone. Consider the following example:
602 * this view is configured with a static-stub zone "example.com",
603 * and an attempt of recursive resolution needs to send a query for the
604 * zone. In this case it's quite likely that the resolver is trying to
605 * find A/AAAA RRs for the apex name "example.com". And, to honor the
606 * static-stub configuration it needs to return the glue RRs in the
607 * static-stub zone even if that exact RRs coming from the authoritative
608 * zone has been cached.
609 * In other general cases, the requested data is better to be
610 * authoritative, either locally configured or retrieved from an external
611 * server, and the data in the static-stub zone should better be ignored.
612 *
613 *\li 'foundname' must meet the requirements of dns_db_find().
614 *
615 *\li If 'sigrdataset' is not NULL, and there is a SIG rdataset which
616 * covers 'type', then 'sigrdataset' will be bound to it.
617 *
618 * Requires:
619 *
620 *\li 'view' is a valid, frozen view.
621 *
622 *\li 'name' is valid name.
623 *
624 *\li 'type' is a valid dns_rdatatype_t, and is not a meta query type
625 * except dns_rdatatype_any.
626 *
627 *\li dbp == NULL || *dbp == NULL
628 *
629 *\li nodep == NULL || *nodep == NULL. If nodep != NULL, dbp != NULL.
630 *
631 *\li 'foundname' is a valid name with a dedicated buffer or NULL.
632 *
633 *\li 'rdataset' is a valid, disassociated rdataset.
634 *
635 *\li 'sigrdataset' is NULL, or is a valid, disassociated rdataset.
636 *
637 * Ensures:
638 *
639 *\li In successful cases, 'rdataset', and possibly 'sigrdataset', are
640 * bound to the found data.
641 *
642 *\li If dbp != NULL, it points to the database containing the data.
643 *
644 *\li If nodep != NULL, it points to the database node containing the data.
645 *
646 *\li If foundname != NULL, it contains the full name of the found data.
647 *
648 * Returns:
649 *
650 *\li Any result that dns_db_find() can return, with the exception of
651 * #DNS_R_DELEGATION.
652 */
653
654isc_result_t
655dns_view_simplefind(dns_view_t *view, const dns_name_t *name,
656 dns_rdatatype_t type, isc_stdtime_t now,
657 unsigned int options, bool use_hints,
658 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset, dns_rdataset_t *sigrdataset);
659/*%<
660 * Find an rdataset whose owner name is 'name', and whose type is
661 * 'type'.
662 *
663 * Notes:
664 *
665 *\li This routine is appropriate for simple, exact-match queries of the
666 * view. 'name' must be a canonical name; there is no DNAME or CNAME
667 * processing.
668 *
669 *\li See the description of dns_db_find() for information about 'options'.
670 * If the caller sets DNS_DBFIND_GLUEOK, it must ensure that 'name'
671 * and 'type' are appropriate for glue retrieval.
672 *
673 *\li If 'now' is zero, then the current time will be used.
674 *
675 *\li If 'use_hints' is true, and the view has a hints database, then
676 * it will be searched last. If the answer is found in the hints
677 * database, the result code will be DNS_R_HINT. If the name is found
678 * in the hints database but not the type, the result code will be
679 * DNS_R_HINTNXRRSET.
680 *
681 *\li If 'sigrdataset' is not NULL, and there is a SIG rdataset which
682 * covers 'type', then 'sigrdataset' will be bound to it.
683 *
684 * Requires:
685 *
686 *\li 'view' is a valid, frozen view.
687 *
688 *\li 'name' is valid name.
689 *
690 *\li 'type' is a valid dns_rdatatype_t, and is not a meta query type
691 * (e.g. dns_rdatatype_any), or dns_rdatatype_rrsig.
692 *
693 *\li 'rdataset' is a valid, disassociated rdataset.
694 *
695 *\li 'sigrdataset' is NULL, or is a valid, disassociated rdataset.
696 *
697 * Ensures:
698 *
699 *\li In successful cases, 'rdataset', and possibly 'sigrdataset', are
700 * bound to the found data.
701 *
702 * Returns:
703 *
704 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS Success; result is desired type.
705 *\li DNS_R_GLUE Success; result is glue.
706 *\li DNS_R_HINT Success; result is a hint.
707 *\li DNS_R_NCACHENXDOMAIN Success; result is a ncache entry.
708 *\li DNS_R_NCACHENXRRSET Success; result is a ncache entry.
709 *\li DNS_R_NXDOMAIN The name does not exist.
710 *\li DNS_R_NXRRSET The rrset does not exist.
711 *\li #ISC_R_NOTFOUND No matching data found,
712 * or an error occurred.
713 */
714
715isc_result_t
716dns_view_findzonecut(dns_view_t *view, const dns_name_t *name,
717 dns_name_t *fname, dns_name_t *dcname, isc_stdtime_t now,
718 unsigned int options,
719 bool use_hints, bool use_cache,
720 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset, dns_rdataset_t *sigrdataset);
721/*%<
722 * Find the best known zonecut containing 'name'.
723 *
724 * This uses local authority, cache, and optionally hints data.
725 * No external queries are performed.
726 *
727 * Notes:
728 *
729 *\li If 'now' is zero, then the current time will be used.
730 *
731 *\li If 'use_hints' is true, and the view has a hints database, then
732 * it will be searched last.
733 *
734 *\li If 'use_cache' is true, and the view has a cache, then it will be
735 * searched.
736 *
737 *\li If 'sigrdataset' is not NULL, and there is a SIG rdataset which
738 * covers 'type', then 'sigrdataset' will be bound to it.
739 *
740 *\li If the DNS_DBFIND_NOEXACT option is set, then the zonecut returned
741 * (if any) will be the deepest known ancestor of 'name'.
742 *
743 *\li If dcname is not NULL the deepest cached name is copied to it.
744 *
745 * Requires:
746 *
747 *\li 'view' is a valid, frozen view.
748 *
749 *\li 'name' is valid name.
750 *
751 *\li 'rdataset' is a valid, disassociated rdataset.
752 *
753 *\li 'sigrdataset' is NULL, or is a valid, disassociated rdataset.
754 *
755 * Returns:
756 *
757 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS Success.
758 *
759 *\li Many other results are possible.
760 */
761
762isc_result_t
763dns_viewlist_find(dns_viewlist_t *list, const char *name,
764 dns_rdataclass_t rdclass, dns_view_t **viewp);
765/*%<
766 * Search for a view with name 'name' and class 'rdclass' in 'list'.
767 * If found, '*viewp' is (strongly) attached to it.
768 *
769 * Requires:
770 *
771 *\li 'viewp' points to a NULL dns_view_t *.
772 *
773 * Returns:
774 *
775 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS A matching view was found.
776 *\li #ISC_R_NOTFOUND No matching view was found.
777 */
778
779isc_result_t
780dns_viewlist_findzone(dns_viewlist_t *list, const dns_name_t *name,
781 bool allclasses, dns_rdataclass_t rdclass,
782 dns_zone_t **zonep);
783
784/*%<
785 * Search zone with 'name' in view with 'rdclass' in viewlist 'list'
786 * If found, zone is returned in *zonep. If allclasses is set rdclass is ignored
787 *
788 * Returns:
789 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS A matching zone was found.
790 *\li #ISC_R_NOTFOUND No matching zone was found.
791 *\li #ISC_R_MULTIPLE Multiple zones with the same name were found.
792 */
793
794isc_result_t
795dns_view_findzone(dns_view_t *view, const dns_name_t *name,
796 dns_zone_t **zonep);
797/*%<
798 * Search for the zone 'name' in the zone table of 'view'.
799 * If found, 'zonep' is (strongly) attached to it. There
800 * are no partial matches.
801 *
802 * Requires:
803 *
804 *\li 'zonep' points to a NULL dns_zone_t *.
805 *
806 * Returns:
807 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS A matching zone was found.
808 *\li #ISC_R_NOTFOUND No matching zone was found.
809 *\li others An error occurred.
810 */
811
812isc_result_t
813dns_view_load(dns_view_t *view, bool stop, bool newonly);
814
815isc_result_t
816dns_view_asyncload(dns_view_t *view, bool newonly, dns_zt_allloaded_t callback,
817 void *arg);
818/*%<
819 * Load zones attached to this view. dns_view_load() loads
820 * all zones whose master file has changed since the last
821 * load
822 *
823 * dns_view_asyncload() loads zones asynchronously. When all zones
824 * in the view have finished loading, 'callback' is called with argument
825 * 'arg' to inform the caller.
826 *
827 * If 'stop' is true, stop on the first error and return it.
828 * If 'stop' is false (or we are loading asynchronously), ignore errors.
829 *
830 * If 'newonly' is true load only zones that were never loaded.
831 *
832 * Requires:
833 *
834 *\li 'view' is valid.
835 */
836
837isc_result_t
838dns_view_gettsig(dns_view_t *view, const dns_name_t *keyname,
839 dns_tsigkey_t **keyp);
840/*%<
841 * Find the TSIG key configured in 'view' with name 'keyname',
842 * if any.
843 *
844 * Requires:
845 *\li keyp points to a NULL dns_tsigkey_t *.
846 *
847 * Returns:
848 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS A key was found and '*keyp' now points to it.
849 *\li #ISC_R_NOTFOUND No key was found.
850 *\li others An error occurred.
851 */
852
853isc_result_t
854dns_view_getpeertsig(dns_view_t *view, const isc_netaddr_t *peeraddr,
855 dns_tsigkey_t **keyp);
856/*%<
857 * Find the TSIG key configured in 'view' for the server whose
858 * address is 'peeraddr', if any.
859 *
860 * Requires:
861 * keyp points to a NULL dns_tsigkey_t *.
862 *
863 * Returns:
864 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS A key was found and '*keyp' now points to it.
865 *\li #ISC_R_NOTFOUND No key was found.
866 *\li others An error occurred.
867 */
868
869isc_result_t
870dns_view_checksig(dns_view_t *view, isc_buffer_t *source, dns_message_t *msg);
871/*%<
872 * Verifies the signature of a message.
873 *
874 * Requires:
875 *
876 *\li 'view' is a valid view.
877 *\li 'source' is a valid buffer containing the message
878 *\li 'msg' is a valid message
879 *
880 * Returns:
881 *\li see dns_tsig_verify()
882 */
883
884void
885dns_view_dialup(dns_view_t *view);
886/*%<
887 * Perform dialup-time maintenance on the zones of 'view'.
888 */
889
890isc_result_t
891dns_view_dumpdbtostream(dns_view_t *view, FILE *fp);
892/*%<
893 * Dump the current state of the view 'view' to the stream 'fp'
894 * for purposes of analysis or debugging.
895 *
896 * Currently the dumped state includes the view's cache; in the future
897 * it may also include other state such as the address database.
898 * It will not not include authoritative data since it is voluminous and
899 * easily obtainable by other means.
900 *
901 * Requires:
902 *
903 *\li 'view' is valid.
904 *
905 *\li 'fp' refers to a file open for writing.
906 *
907 * Returns:
908 * \li ISC_R_SUCCESS The cache was successfully dumped.
909 * \li others An error occurred (see dns_master_dump)
910 */
911
912isc_result_t
913dns_view_flushcache(dns_view_t *view, bool fixuponly);
914/*%<
915 * Flush the view's cache (and ADB). If 'fixuponly' is true, it only updates
916 * the internal reference to the cache DB with omitting actual flush operation.
917 * 'fixuponly' is intended to be used for a view that shares a cache with
918 * a different view. dns_view_flushcache() is a backward compatible version
919 * that always sets fixuponly to false.
920 *
921 * Requires:
922 * 'view' is valid.
923 *
924 * No other tasks are executing.
925 *
926 * Returns:
927 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
928 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
929 */
930
931isc_result_t
932dns_view_flushnode(dns_view_t *view, const dns_name_t *name,
933 bool tree);
934/*%<
935 * Flush the given name from the view's cache (and optionally ADB/badcache).
936 *
937 * Flush the given name from the cache, ADB, and bad cache. If 'tree'
938 * is true, also flush all subdomains of 'name'.
939 *
940 * Requires:
941 *\li 'view' is valid.
942 *\li 'name' is valid.
943 *
944 * Returns:
945 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
946 * other returns are failures.
947 */
948
949isc_result_t
950dns_view_flushname(dns_view_t *view, const dns_name_t *name);
951/*%<
952 * Flush the given name from the view's cache, ADB and badcache.
953 * Equivalent to dns_view_flushnode(view, name, false).
954 *
955 *
956 * Requires:
957 *\li 'view' is valid.
958 *\li 'name' is valid.
959 *
960 * Returns:
961 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
962 * other returns are failures.
963 */
964
965isc_result_t
966dns_view_adddelegationonly(dns_view_t *view, const dns_name_t *name);
967/*%<
968 * Add the given name to the delegation only table.
969 *
970 * Requires:
971 *\li 'view' is valid.
972 *\li 'name' is valid.
973 *
974 * Returns:
975 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
976 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
977 */
978
979isc_result_t
980dns_view_excludedelegationonly(dns_view_t *view, const dns_name_t *name);
981/*%<
982 * Add the given name to be excluded from the root-delegation-only.

984 *
985 * Requires:
986 *\li 'view' is valid.
987 *\li 'name' is valid.
988 *
989 * Returns:

996/*%<

1088/*%<

1090 * statistic set is installed, view's resolver will count outgoing queries
1091 * per rdata type.

1104 * untouched.

1107 * \li 'view' is valid and is not frozen.
1108 *
1109 *\li 'statsp' != NULL && '*statsp' != NULL
1110 */
1111
1112bool
1113dns_view_iscacheshared(dns_view_t *view);
1114/*%<
1115 * Check if the view shares the cache created by another view.
1116 *
1117 * Requires:
1118 * \li 'view' is valid.
1119 *
1120 * Returns:
1121 *\li #true if the cache is shared.
1122 *\li #false otherwise.

1124
1125isc_result_t
1126dns_view_initntatable(dns_view_t *view,
1127 isc_taskmgr_t *taskmgr, isc_timermgr_t *timermgr);
1128/*%<
1129 * Initialize the negative trust anchor table for the view.
1130 *
1131 * Requires:
1132 * \li 'view' is valid.
1133 *
1134 * Returns:
1135 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
1136 *\li Any other result indicates failure
1137 */
1138
1139isc_result_t
1140dns_view_getntatable(dns_view_t *view, dns_ntatable_t **ntp);
1141/*%<
1142 * Get the negative trust anchor table for this view. Returns
1143 * ISC_R_NOTFOUND if the table not been initialized for the view.
1144 *
1145 * '*ntp' is attached on success; the caller is responsible for
1146 * detaching it with dns_ntatable_detach().
1147 *
1148 * Requires:
1149 * \li 'view' is valid.
1150 * \li 'nta' is not NULL and '*nta' is NULL.
1151 *
1152 * Returns:
1153 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
1154 *\li ISC_R_NOTFOUND
1155 */
1156
1157isc_result_t
1158dns_view_initsecroots(dns_view_t *view, isc_mem_t *mctx);
1159/*%<
1160 * Initialize security roots for the view, detaching any previously
1161 * existing security roots first. (Note that secroots_priv is
1162 * NULL until this function is called, so any function using
1163 * security roots must check that they have been initialized first.
1164 * One way to do this is use dns_view_getsecroots() and check its
1165 * return value.)
1166 *
1167 * Requires:
1168 * \li 'view' is valid.
1169 *
1170 * Returns:
1171 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
1172 *\li Any other result indicates failure
1173 */
1174
1175isc_result_t
1176dns_view_getsecroots(dns_view_t *view, dns_keytable_t **ktp);
1177/*%<
1178 * Get the security roots for this view. Returns ISC_R_NOTFOUND if
1179 * the security roots keytable has not been initialized for the view.
1180 *
1181 * '*ktp' is attached on success; the caller is responsible for
1182 * detaching it with dns_keytable_detach().
1183 *
1184 * Requires:
1185 * \li 'view' is valid.
1186 * \li 'ktp' is not NULL and '*ktp' is NULL.
1187 *
1188 * Returns:
1189 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
1190 *\li ISC_R_NOTFOUND
1191 */
1192
1193isc_result_t
1194dns_view_issecuredomain(dns_view_t *view, const dns_name_t *name,
1195 isc_stdtime_t now, bool checknta,
1196 bool *secure_domain);
1197/*%<
1198 * Is 'name' at or beneath a trusted key, and not covered by a valid
1199 * negative trust anchor? Put answer in '*secure_domain'.
1200 *
1201 * If 'checknta' is false, ignore the NTA table in determining
1202 * whether this is a secure domain.
1203 *
1204 * Requires:
1205 * \li 'view' is valid.
1206 *
1207 * Returns:
1208 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
1209 *\li Any other value indicates failure
1210 */
1211
1212bool
1213dns_view_ntacovers(dns_view_t *view, isc_stdtime_t now,
1214 const dns_name_t *name, const dns_name_t *anchor);
1215/*%<
1216 * Is there a current negative trust anchor above 'name' and below 'anchor'?
1217 *
1218 * Requires:
1219 * \li 'view' is valid.
1220 *
1221 * Returns:
1222 *\li ISC_R_TRUE
1223 *\li ISC_R_FALSE
1224 */
1225
1226void
1227dns_view_untrust(dns_view_t *view, const dns_name_t *keyname,
1228 dns_rdata_dnskey_t *dnskey, isc_mem_t *mctx);
1229/*%<
1230 * Remove keys that match 'keyname' and 'dnskey' from the views trust
1231 * anchors.
1232 *
1233 * (NOTE: If the configuration specifies that there should be a
1234 * trust anchor at 'keyname', but no keys are left after this
1235 * operation, that is an error. We fail closed, inserting a NULL
1236 * key so as to prevent validation until a legimitate key has been
1237 * provided.)
1238 *
1239 * Requires:
1240 * \li 'view' is valid.
1241 * \li 'keyname' is valid.
1242 * \li 'mctx' is valid.
1243 * \li 'dnskey' is valid.
1244 */
1245
1246isc_result_t
1247dns_view_setnewzones(dns_view_t *view, bool allow, void *cfgctx,
1248 void (*cfg_destroy)(void **), uint64_t mapsize);
1249/*%<
1250 * Set whether or not to allow zones to be created or deleted at runtime.
1251 *
1252 * If 'allow' is true, determines the filename into which new zone
1253 * configuration will be written. Preserves the configuration context
1254 * (a pointer to which is passed in 'cfgctx') for use when parsing new
1255 * zone configuration. 'cfg_destroy' points to a callback routine to
1256 * destroy the configuration context when the view is destroyed. (This
1257 * roundabout method is used in order to avoid libdns having a dependency
1258 * on libisccfg and libbind9.)
1259 *
1260 * If 'allow' is false, removes any existing references to
1261 * configuration context and frees any memory.
1262 *
1263 * Requires:
1264 * \li 'view' is valid.
1265 *
1266 * Returns:
1267 * \li ISC_R_SUCCESS
1268 * \li ISC_R_NOSPACE
1269 */
1270
1271void
1272dns_view_setnewzonedir(dns_view_t *view, const char *dir);
1273const char *
1274dns_view_getnewzonedir(dns_view_t *view);
1275/*%<
1276 * Set/get the path to the directory in which NZF or NZD files should
1277 * be stored. If the path was previously set to a non-NULL value,
1278 * the previous value is freed.
1279 *
1280 * Requires:
1281 * \li 'view' is valid.
1282 */
1283
1284void
1285dns_view_restorekeyring(dns_view_t *view);
1286
1287isc_result_t
1288dns_view_searchdlz(dns_view_t *view, const dns_name_t *name,
1289 unsigned int minlabels,
1290 dns_clientinfomethods_t *methods,
1291 dns_clientinfo_t *clientinfo,
1292 dns_db_t **dbp);
1293
1294/*%<
1295 * Search through the DLZ database(s) in view->dlz_searched to find
1296 * one that can answer a query for 'name', using the DLZ driver's
1297 * findzone method. If successful, '*dbp' is set to point to the
1298 * DLZ database.
1299 *
1300 * Returns:
1301 * \li ISC_R_SUCCESS
1302 * \li ISC_R_NOTFOUND
1303 *
1304 * Requires:
1305 * \li 'view' is valid.
1306 * \li 'name' is not NULL.
1307 * \li 'dbp' is not NULL and *dbp is NULL.
1308 */
1309
1310uint32_t
1311dns_view_getfailttl(dns_view_t *view);
1312/*%<
1313 * Get the view's servfail-ttl. zero => no servfail caching.
1314 *
1315 * Requires:
1316 *\li 'view' to be valid.
1317 */
1318
1319void
1320dns_view_setfailttl(dns_view_t *view, uint32_t failttl);
1321/*%<
1322 * Set the view's servfail-ttl. zero => no servfail caching.
1323 *
1324 * Requires:
1325 *\li 'view' to be valid.
1326 */
1327
1328isc_result_t
1329dns_view_saventa(dns_view_t *view);
1330/*%<
1331 * Save NTA for names in this view to a file.
1332 *
1333 * Requires:
1334 *\li 'view' to be valid.
1335 */
1336
1337isc_result_t
1338dns_view_loadnta(dns_view_t *view);
1339/*%<
1340 * Loads NTA for names in this view from a file.
1341 *
1342 * Requires:
1343 *\li 'view' to be valid.
1344 */
1345
1346void
1347dns_view_setviewcommit(dns_view_t *view);
1348/*%<
1349 * Commit dns_zone_setview() calls previously made for all zones in this
1350 * view.
1351 *
1352 * Requires:
1353 *\li 'view' to be valid.
1354 */
1355
1356void
1357dns_view_setviewrevert(dns_view_t *view);

1359 * Revert dns_zone_setview() calls previously made for all zones in this

1361 *
1362 * Requires:
